text.0: like aṅgiras a gladdening laud we ponder to him who loveth song exceeding mighty.
text.1: let us sing glory to the farfamed hero who must be praised with fair hymns by the singer.
text.2: unto the great bring ye great adoration a chant with praise to him exceeding mighty.
text.3: through whom our sires aṅgirases singing praises and knowing well the places found the cattle.
text.4: when indra and the aṅgirases desired it saramā found provision for her offspring.
text.5: bṛhaspati cleft the mountain found the cattle the heroes shouted with the kine in triumph.
text.6: mid shout loud shout and roar with the navagvas seven singers hast thou heavenly rent the mountain.
text.7: thou hast with speeders with daśagvas indra Śakra with thunder rent obstructive vala.
text.8: praised by aṅgirases thou foedestroyer hast with the dawn sun rays dispelled the darkness.
text.9: thou indra hast spread out the earths high ridges and firmly fixed the region under heaven.
text.10: this is the deed most worthy of all honour the fairest marvel of the wonderworker.
text.11: that nigh where heaven bends down he made four rivers flow full with waves that carry down sweet water.
text.12: unwearied won with lauding hymns he parted of old the ancient pair united ever.
text.13: in highest sky like bhaga he the doer of marvels set both dames and earth and heaven.
text.14: still born afresh young dames each in her manner unlike in hue the pair in alternation.
text.15: round heaven and earth from ancient time have travelled night with her dark limbs dawn with limbs of splendour.
text.16: rich in good actions skilled in operation the son with might maintains his perfect friendship.
text.17: thou in the raw cows black of hue or ruddy storest the ripe milk glossy white in colour.
text.18: their paths of old connected rest uninjured they with great might preserve the immortal statutes.
text.19: for many thousand holy works the sisters wait on the haughty lord like wives and matrons.
text.20: thoughts ancient seeking wealth with adoration with newest lauds have sped to thee o mighty.
text.21: as yearning wives cleave to their yearning husband so cleave our hymns to thee o lord most potent.
text.22: strong god the riches which thy hands have holden from days of old have perished not nor wasted.
text.23: splendid art thou o indra wise unbending strengthen us with might o lord of power.
text.24: o mighty indra gotamas son nodhas hath fashioned this new prayer to thee eternal.
text.25: sure leader yoker of the tawny coursers may he enriched with prayer come soon and early.
